title:
Graça Machel
                    
                
                - Kids | Britannica Kids | Homework Help

quotes: Graça Simbine was born on October 17, 1945, in the Gaza province of Mozambique.
In 1975 she married Samora Machel, the first president of independent Mozambique.
From 1975 until the late 1980s Graça Machel was the minister of education and culture.
She stayed in office even after the death of Samora Machel in 1986.
In July 1998 Graça Machel married Nelson Mandela, the president of South Africa.
In 1996 she made a report to the UN on the effect of war and violence on children.
In 1994 she set up the Foundation

organizations.name: Frelimo
quotes: In 1973 she returned to Mozambique. There she joined Frelimo, a pro-liberation group.

organizations.name: University of Lisbon
quotes: Then she went to Portugal to study at the University of Lisbon.

organizations.name: United Nations (UN)
quotes: Graça Machel began her association with the United Nations (UN) in the 1980s.

roles.title: minister of education and culture
quotes: From 1975 until the late 1980s Graça Machel was the minister of education and culture.
Graça Machel of Mozambique is the only woman who has been married to the presidents of two different countries.
Graça Simbine was born on October 17, 1945, in the Gaza province of Mozambique.
Then she went to Portugal to study at the University of Lisbon.
Then she moved to Tanzania and taught at a Frelimo school.
In July 1998 Graça Machel married Nelson Mandela, the president of South Africa.
